message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DC, cs.AI 

The paper discusses a mechanism to mitigate link-flooding attacks, which is a security issue in computer networks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also proposes an algorithm for link obfuscation, which involves rerouting probing flows, and a bot detection algorithm, which uses Support Vector Machine. These suggest that the paper may also belong to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the paper evaluates the feasibility and performance of the proposed mechanism using simulations, which may indicate that it belongs to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper uses machine learning techniques, specifically Support Vector Machine, which suggests that it may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
